title: Which K-pop groups have the closest members? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, I want to say that I love many groups and watched numerous content from each group that I love. Some of them include iKON, BTS, SUJU, Shinee, Bigbang, Wanna One, SNSD, Red Velvet, Mamamoo, NCT, and more. Second, I really want to say that you can't really say that some group has the closest relationship out of all the KPOP groups, i truly believe that is stupid and unrealistic. I believe, and I think all the groups I love proved it to me, that every group has special bond which is different from other groups. And finally I want to talk about relationship of my ult group, being EXO, at least how I see it. I want to talk about it more because I believe a lot of people has wrong impression. I've seen it so many times, people comparing BTSs and EXOs bonds and as someone who loves both groups I think it is so stupid and incomparable. First, there is so much content that shows BTSs bond, that shows how close they are and how much they love each other, actually there is so much BTS content. You can watch Bangtan TV, BTS Run, Bon Voyage, their constant vlives and twt updates or weverse, like there is so much content that can show you their relationship. With EXO that is not the case, you don't get to see their content on daily level, you don't get another episode of their show each week and then their travel show every now and then, they don't have a channel especially for that kind of videos like Bangtan TV. Actually the difference between BTS and EXO members and their personalities is enormous. Every EXO member is pretty much closed book, they are pretty much introverted and they have boundaries where they want their private life to be just theirs and not show it to everyone, and that is totally fine actually that is something I really love and admire about them. They do not let fans know something that isn't their business and it is completely normaln that they want to keep something private. So I love both groups very much and I believe they all have incredible bonds so I just want to say that you shouldn't jump into conclusions when you see all the BTS content that shows their bond and then say that because you can't see that from EXO they are not close. Now about EXO and EXO alone. As I said I believe that all EXO members appreciate and love their privacy. They are pretty much introverted and human like. I actually don't think there is any other group that has members who are like them and with that kind of bond that I believe they have (again that can be said for every group, cause every group is special in their own way). I believe that that type of personalities they have is something really special in KPOP cause they really don't like being in spotlight more than necessary. I mean look at every one of them, Xiumin, Do, Lay and Kai make it so obvious how much pressure they feel sometimes and I find it so relatable and refreshing. Then you have someone like Baekhyun, he is much more introverted than people assume, he is such a homebody and he enjoys making people happy but he also enjoys making himself happy by spending time alone. Then you have Chen, Suho, Sehun and Chanyeol, they are all more comfortable in spotlight then the first group of members I talked about but they still don't really love their life being in spotlight more then other members, they want their privacy as much as others. So when you see this about them you can see why you can't really read their relationship with others easily. Anyway, I believe they have bond that is so strong, I believe they are more like family than friends actually, and they said that numerous times but somehow everyone chooses to ignore it and say that they don't even like each others that much and that it is all fake and it actually angers me to see someone who didn't even try to learn something about them jumps in the conclusion like that. Actually I think EXO has some of the most honest kpop idols out there, every single one of EXO members say what they think and what they believe even when it is not something fans will like. I mean did you ever see Do not being honest just so he don't hurt someone? I don't think so. So when he said numerous times that sometimes he's members are only thing that is making him continue, that he wishes all the best for his members and that they're like a family which he loves I believe he meant every word. So did Suho when he said the same thing, or Baekhyun, or Chen, or Lay, or Chanyeol, or Kai, or Xiumin, or Sehun, I mean did you all forget that Sehun said that he prayed every night for members? Or did you choose to ignore that like everything else and say they are not close. Or when people use things like 3 members leaving as an excuse to say that they don't like each other, like can you just stop? First, members didn't leave because of other members, they left because of mistreatment, like they wanted more freedom or things SM wouldn't allow them, they even had physical injuries and couldn't see their family's, and you expect them to stay in group just between they love members? Like are you serious? Some things you shouldn't keep up with and if you really care about someone you will understand that, like how Luhan actually talked to members before his decision, Tao wasn't even the one who wanted to leave it was he's father(with full rights) and he cried so much at last concert with EXO. And did you see how Luhan and Lay still hang out sometimes, how he still hasn't unfollowed any of the members, or how Kris said he met right people at the wrong time, how Tao speaks proudly of he's time with EXO, and you choose to ignore that and say that cause 3 members left there is no way EXO are close? I actually think that that only made their bond stronger, that that made them cherish each other more and made saying ‘’ we are one’’ even more meaningful. I mean go and listen to the Promise and see how they feel. And Lay? People love to use Lay as an argument and it also makes me angry. Like if you tried to get to know EXO you would never use Lay for that and if you didn't isn't it wrong to assume that? Lay cares so much about every one of EXO members, do you ever think about how he had been putting up with mistreatment for a long time like other Chinese members, how he could deal with it like others who left but he choose not to, he chose to stay. Do you think about how he constantly talks about EXO on his solo promotions, how he proudly says he's EXO member and that he misses other members so much. Do you think about he's video call to Xiumin before military enlistment or how he literally ran to airport after he came to Korea just to send Do off? Do you think about how he said he will never leave EXO and how he is so sorry for the members cause he can't be with them? Cause if you think of that I don't think you can say anything like he doesn't care for them and he should leave, because he does, very much, and he shouldn't if he doesn't want, and he surely doesn't want that. Lay can't be with them for now because of he's role in China and he is sorry, but he loves them and misses them very much and so does EXO, they said it numerous times how they miss him and love him. So I believe EXOs bond and relationship between every single one of them is so beautiful and unique. They have been together for so long, they've been through a lot together, like do you think debuting from SM is easy, they lost members, every one of them has been criticized for most stupid things (like dating and now all the hate for Chen, I can't even think about how irrational people who attack them for things like that are), and they still stood next to each other through all of that. They talked about how much they feel like a family and how much they love each other and are comfortable around each other. As I said their relationship is so beautiful, they always support each other, literally every solo activity they have (and they have a lot)they always defend each other (like Sehun calling Suho during his live to say to him that he saw some bad comments and that he is so mad, he told Suho that he shouldn't pay attention to that and that he is the best), the level of comfort they feel around each other ( like when I watched Xiumin in Its dangerous beyond the blanket he was so distant and tense but when he is with EXO he is so natural and comfortable), the way they tease each other and the way they smile at each other (like have you seen Do smile at Baekhyun, adorable), they say they miss the members whenever they do solo activities (like do you think they are obligated to say that kind of things? Or to support each other solo activities?), they show how much they love and care for each other numerous times but you just choose to ignore it. Their relationship is different, it is absolutely not forced in any way, they will not do some unnecessary skinship(like why would they? Do you think that means someone js close?), they will not say more about their bond than they feel is for you to hear and they will not try to prove to you something that isn't for you to approve of. They love and care for each other in most natural and precious way they could. Their relationship is so pure and mature. And I believe every one of them is close to every member and they have so unique relationships between them. Like Bakhyun and Chen, their relationship is sooo adorable, they've been together through audition and thought only one of them will succeed and they both told the other one thay he was great and that he will be chosen, but they were both accepted, they went through audition and training together and debuted in EXO and their relationship is so precious. Or Sehun and Suho, like they are literally so attached to each other that is so adorable and that is all I will say. I am not going to talk about every pair cause if I start I will not finish and I definitely wrote enough, more than enough. To conclude, their bond is so special and strong that it amazes me, you can see it if you think about how they are 9 introverts but when they are together it feels like they are in the most comfortable space they can be. They have relationship that feels like family full of wonderful people who care and love each other deeply but not feel obligated to show that to everyone. And that is beautiful and I like their relationship the most out of KPOP groups, I'm not saying they are the closest or anything (as I said, I think you can't give that title to someone) but it is the bond that I like the most and find so natural and pure, honest and special.

I can't really tell you for sure because what we see is on screen and we don't know how they treat each other off screen. I will only focus on boybands since I am not familiar with any korean girlgroups and on bands I am very familiar with. Some EXO members seem very close on camera especially Baekhyun with the members even though there was a rumor that Baek and Chans bromance/romance whatever you believe was scriped. Kai and D.O. seem like they are very close off camera in my opinion. I do believe that Chanyeol and Suho are way closer off camera than they show because they have known each other the longest. In Got7 Yugyeom and BamBam seem very close to each other and of course JJ (Jinyoung and Jaebum) because they were training for a long time together and should've even debuted with Shownu from Monsta X (little funfact). In Monsta X Jooheon and Shownu have an adorable relationship which doesn't seem very scripted and I think Minhyuk is close with many members since he touches / hugs members a lot. Also I.M. and Wonho seem to be very close off camera. I think Monsta X is very close in general since they did No.Mercy together which was cruel and it really brought them together as a group and as friends. BigBang stated that some members were childhood friends. Now to BTS. I may be biased here because they are my UB-group but I think they have the most genuine relationships. I'm not saying the other bands relationships are fake or bad but BTS seems the realest to me and so I'll answer with BTS having the closest members. Taehyung and Jimin are basically best friend goals. They take walks outside at night off camera, Taehyung wrote a song about Jimin, Tae bought Jimin a very expensive birthday gift (gucci sweather for 1100$) and he randomly gifts Jimin some things. They feed each other very often and they called each other soulmates. They plan to travel together. Jungkook seems to look up to Rapmonster like an actual big brother. He asks him what he should pack and always talks about how much of a great leader and role model RM is. He even quotes things RMs father told RM. Suga and Jhope are very very close. Suga once stayed at the dorm on christmas so that Jhope wouldn't have to be alone instead of going home to his own family. They want to do a sub-unit. They wear couple outfits. They have a streaming show which is just them. They may seem to have few interactions on camera but they are very close. They never stop praising each other. Just google “Suga screaming Jhope”. Jhope is the one that comforts Suga when he's crying (Daesang award). Those were just 3 relationships I described. RM and Jin have an awesome relationship too. JKs admiration for Suga is so huge that he won't stop talking about lamb skewers because that's a thing they eat together (=spending time). Jin and Suga called each other perfect roommates and they don't want to change roommates because they like each other that much. Don't get me started on any relationship in which Jimin is involved (especially with JK). But that all is just my opinion and I can't say anything for sure because we don't see them off camera.

response.answer_text: We cannot tell that they are that close just because we saw them hugging in pictures, make jokes in videos, kissing their cheeks on some clips. Perhaps I could tell that they just do it for their fans and all were scripted. You can’t tell this and that group is the closest if one person lacks in attention, gets awkward with co-member and gets shy. Nevertheless, you can still watch them hanging out (but not totally like they’ve known theirselves that deep, like they knew their members everything from their souls to personalities) Believe me or not, GOT7 has the realest and purest relationship among in kpop industry. They don’t hesitate to expose their past history. Maknaes shared problems with their hyungs. (Watch Got2Day. That show isn’t scripted) They don’t care what people say to them, they just want to show their real sides to each other. They diss with each other, make fun with each other, do stupid stuff like no tomorrow. Have you encountered other kpop who can do those things like them? Even myself if I’m not close with one of my member, I won’t make a joke or make silly things with her/him. One of the best example is they’re really close with their members’ families. (have you watched the clip where Bambam pushed Mark’s mom on the pool and Jackson being the rescuer) Bambam’s mom is a die hard fan of GOT7 members, specially to Jaebum. Jackson’s mom is a GOT7 stan, she even posted a picture of each GOT7 members and greet them a happy birthday. Yugyeom and Bambam are best of friends like no one can beat their friendship. You forgot JJP? Real brothers and best friends for almost 8 years and counting and Yugyeom is their die hard fan. Don’t forget Jackson, the biggest fan of GOT6. Jackson is known for being a loyal, protector, savior and make things to lighten up the mood of his members when he feels that there’s something awkward between the six. (Not the literal awkward. You know, some misunderstanding and small fights.) He would take a risk for his 6 brothers no matter what. (Watch Real GOT7 episode 5 so you’ll get what I’m saying. It’s the episode where he defend and protect Yugyeom from JB (All of them were into it btw. Only Jackson can’t stand to what they were doing to Yugyeom. He was born that way. Being a savior with everyone.) Watch and you would cry hard.) That was just a prank though. But still it makes me emotional whenever I watch it lol Yugyeom being a sweet youngest (He tells Jackson that he misses him because he was gone for a while. Jackson was in China at that time.) Yugyeom loves Bambam like his biological brother. Bambam said that if ever GOT7 will be disbanded one day (And I hope that won’t happen) he will take Yugyeom in Thailand to live with him. And before I forget, Jinyoung once said in Got2Day “You should not ask if we are friends, because being friends and having a deep relationship is quite different. We are family.” Ps. Don’t mind these. They are just cute here. Leader (GOT7) vs. Leader (Jus2)  JackBam coz why not  MarkBam the real siblings.  lols  JJP with their no. 1 fan (youngest son)  *heart beat*  We own the camera .gif  When puberty hits you  Pps. This is just for fun lol lol lol

The 7 members of BTS are so genuinely close with eachother, just by watching their interactions, their bond as a group is so prominent. This is a major reason as to why I stan them.  They’ve been living together for over 5 years at this point. (A few longer if you’re including pre-debut training) Their personalities are all so different yet blend together really well. I also think it helps that there isn’t ONE super popular member, sure the Maknae line gets more attention, but a lot of the ARMY love and appreciate all of the members. They’ve also gone through so many hardships from the beginning, having debuted from a small unknown company and really working their way up. It’s brought them a lot closer because it’s never really been a strictly ‘coworker’, success achieving, situation. I think all the members are so close with one another, to the point where you can literally ship any member with any of the others. When watching their interactions, you can see that their relationship extends further than just co-workers or even friends. We see them laughing and having fun together like friends do, but we also see them being vulnerable and having serious conversations. They are a family, a group of brothers (They’ve said so themselves) For instance, in their Burn The Stage series, we witnessed Taehyung and Jin having a small argument, which resulted in tears. But at the end, they talked it out and made up. RM admits in an interview that it’s normal to have conflict but it’s how each person deals with it that matters. Jin saying in that Interview; “No, we’re not friends, we’re family!” In Bon Voyage 2, when they were talking about their future, Yoongi says he wishes they’d remain close until they’re grandparents.When Jungkook literally wrote a song dedicated to his fellow members (Begin) Talking about how they helped raise him as a teenager and how much he loves and appreciates them :”)  In another interview, Taehyung says that sometimes when they have breaks or promotional activities, they don’t see each other for a few days and he misses the other membersDuring their 2018 Festa, where Yoongi admitted to sending long texts to Jungkook and Taehyung and telling them he loved them.  Jin admitting he gets nervous when he isn’t around his membersIn Bon Voyage 2 when each member had to write a letter to another member and Taehyung literally teared up when talking about Jimin In Run Ep 56, where the members each wrote a poem addressed to themselves as a group. It was super emotional Them comforting each other in sad times. Eg. Jimin comforting Hoseok when he was crying on his birthday, or him hugging Taehyung when he talked about his Grandmothers passing, or comforting Yoongi when he saw his parents in the audience.   When they go out of the way to do something for the other. Eg. In Bon Voyage 3 where members, Taehyung, RM and Jimin randomly bought gifts for the other members because they thought of them.Whenever another member is missing (eg. Yoongi when he was hospitalized or Taehyung at the beginning of Bon Voyage 3) The others constantly bring them up and exclaim that they miss him  They have become so used to each other’s presence. They can tell who the other person is just by hearing them sigh or by smelling their hand? They know each other so well:  Sorry that was super long and I don’t have evidence for some but I just remember hearing them say that. Their bond makes me super emotional, you can probably tell. Honestly, I could talk about this for days on end but I would drown in my own tears. In conclusion, they are a wonderful family who love and respect each other. Please watch this Youtube Video which explains it well:

Shinhwa & BAP. Shinhwa is the other name for brotherhood. They filed a lawsuit against SM together, rejected attractive individual contracts, fought a long legal battle of 12 years, set up their own company, waited for every single member to go and return from their military service, and kick started a new stage of their career. Shinhwa debuted in 1998. Their last comeback was in 2016 with their 13th album. They are the longest running kpop band with no change in the lineup for 19 years. What else is there to say? And well okay I don’t know BAP that well but yeah. Just from the fact that BAP filled the lawsuit as a group, stayed a group after it was resolved (?) speaks volumes to me. Other groups would be: Sechs Kies. They debuted in 1997, disbanded in 2000, stayed friends and collaborated with each other many times for the 16 years they were apart, regrouped in 2016 with 5 out of the 6 original lineup (Ko Jiyoung, who stayed out of the group’s comeback because he has fully left the entertainment industry and has his own business and family to attend to, has voiced up multiple times that he’s always Sechs Kies’ number 1 fan). I would also attribute their closeness to the fact that most of them were friends way before they formed the group. Eun Jiwon and Kang Sunghoon knew each other since 1995 when they were studying abroad in Hawaii. Kang Sunghoon and Ko Jiyoung were elementary schoolmates. Kim Jaeduk and Lee Jaejin grew up together in Busan and were in the same dance crew, they auditioned together for Sechs Kies. It’s their 20th anniversary this year.Super Junior. No one expected SJ to be close, because hey, 13 people is a lot. 2 members have officially left the group to pursue a different career. A few others are tangled up in issues so they’re on a permanent hiatus. SJ brands themselves as a group that’s only “for show”, but they’ve never acknowledged any number except 13, no matter in what sensitive situation. This group decided to not release any new albums in the 2 years their leader enlisted (to honour his contributions to the team because seriously Leeteuk singlehandedly raised half the members and held the team together through the shakiest debut days), a decision not understood by many. Majority of the member trained together for 3–5 years before their debut. “We acknowledge that each other are different” is why they last so long. Only 2 more members have yet to complete their military service. They started out as a project group that was meant to disband after one year of activity. This year marks their 12th anniversary.TVXQ/DBSK. Some wouldn’t agree because they’ve been apart for longer than they’re together, but I’d like to believe otherwise. Junsu took Yunho home when Yunho was sleeping on the streets. When Yoochun first came from US, his residence was registered under Junsu’s household. I would think TVXQ share a very special bond because of their Japanese debut struggles. In 2006, SM sent TVXQ, who were at their peak in Korea, off to a foreign market: Japan. Japan was NOT receptive of kpop at all. TVXQ was left there, stranded for months, handing out flyers and albums on the street begging people to give them a listen. Most of them ended up with depression. They climbed to the top in Japan together, and broke all kinds of records for foreign singers there. The lawsuit was painfully hard to believe. They had amazing teamwork as 5 and it really shone through their acapellas (I’ve never heard any magic like how their voices blend together).GOD. 4 of the original 5 lineup suffered immensely from their company’s neglect in their pre-debut days (their dorms had no hot water, and at some point there wasn’t even water because the pipe was frozen). They had no money and their only source of livelihood was their eldest (Joon Park)’s minor earning. They debuted in 1999, and by 2006 the members went in separate ways but with a promise that they will reunite. In 2014, they kept that promise with their 15th anniversary concert. They had a few comebacks after that, and in early 2017 they had a tour too. This is their 18th year, with the exact line-up.I’d say most 1st generation groups are really close. Most started from the bottom, and held each other tight as they rose to fame and were overworked by the company. Most groups went their separate ways because they wanted to pursue a different music career from the group’s, but that wasn’t allowed back then. Most 1st gen idols I’ve seen have kept in contact with each other over the years. Another kind would be idols who started from small companies and eventually made it big. Groups like Infinite and BTS. Not only are they close with each other, they also share a closer bond with their CEO/producer and company staff.

I will say Got7 and BTS. I think Got7 mostly consists of chaotic people but they have their sweet times, while BTS mostly consists of sweet people but they have their chaotic times. I follow Got7 more so I will just talk about them (to add to the other replies here). In 2020, I can say that they still hung out a lot with each other outside promotion. Bambam, Jackson, Mark, Yugyeom hangout together for Jackson’s birthday while Jackson was in Korea. Mark and Yugyeom hang out a lot because they live close to each other and recently finally Dalkyum (Yugyeom’s very cute new puppy) meets Milo (Mark’s dog)! And Yugyeom had dinner with Mark and his family when they visited Korea. Mark’s family also visited JB’s parents at their restaurant (I’m so down for this Parents7 association). Oh and Yugyeom also had dinner with Mark’s family when he went to LA earlier this year. Jinyoung has dinner together with Yugyeom while watching his newest drama. All of them still watch Jinyoung drama by themselves though. Well… except for Bambam who admitted that he already watched another drama that aired at the same time with Jinyoung’s and promises that he will get to it after the drama is finished (and we all know how salty Jinyoung about this 😂😂). They are being totally supportive and never stop ‘subtly’ (or not so subtly🤣) promoting YoungJae who always wants to be a radio DJ in every radio shows that they visited until now YoungJae becomes the permanent DJ on Idol Radio. And I think YoungJae and JB are making music together because Youngjae updated an instastory at a studio that looks very much like JB’s. Okay, I think I should stop my rant there or I will never stop. LOL. But yeah besides all of the tv shows and their Hard Carry reality shows, those small unfilmed interactions are the ones that convince me that these boys are real family outside the camera. Yes, they have members that are closer to each other more than the others, but don’t you always have that closest brothers/sisters in your family? So there it is!

I think it is definitely exo in this case cause exo have been with each other for such long time and they have lived together , been together with each other in ups and downs of life . As you may know that exo doesnot really get the chance to do many activities like vlives , or tweets or many variety shows nor do they have a channel where they can post alot of videos together . Maybe it is cause of their agency but they dont get to do alot of content yet we can see from the reality shows or variety shows they do once , now and then that they are extremely close to each other . Normally when you are not very close to each other , you behave well with each other and talk politely but once you get close to each other , you joke around , make fun of each other , talk about stupid things , tease each other and that is exactly what exo does . Exo are actually one of the most honest kpop groups out there and that everyone agrees . When d.o gets annoyed of another member he just goes and hits them , telling them to stop . They annoy the shit out of each other just like brothers . You know real siblings ? Ya , that type of bond . They joke about things , take showers together , support each other’s solo activities , kiss each other , hit each other , annoy each other , yet care about each other so much . They are close to the extend that people cant accept they are just friends , and keep saying they must be dating . Despite of not getting much screen time , whether it is in award shows or variety shows or travel shows that they do , their bond is so strong . Whether it is chanyeols mom coming to suprise d.o on his fan meeting ,or baekhyun and chanyeol found on trips and dates together by citizens ,or d.o cooking food for them all the time , or them saying that even though in the future if exo is not much popular but they want to call themselves members of exo , or them saying that even if they stay in sm or leave sm or start their own label but they will alwys be together , or sehun praying every night for his members, or members being super proud seeing sehun sing his rap parts , or baekhyun being loud af and joking around all the time getting hit by laughing chanyeol , d.o saying that he doesnot much fit in celebrity life and has thought about quitting lots of times but his members were the reason he wanted to stay ( and to people who dont know , d.o is known to be brutally honest about things and not sugar coat things , so he seriously meant what is said ) . Even members going to support each others solo activities like exo members went to baekhyuns candy inkigayo (even when chen was getting such hate from toxic people , he went to congratulate him ) . Even xiumin and chen have said in multiple occasions that they are just like a married couple , and all the members are always annoying and teasing the shit out of leader mama suho where suho has to always keep his calm and manage things around them . They are not in the limit of how friends are , cause friends are i love u , i thank u , sorry , e.t.c ,but they are in the zone of brothers where they annoy each other , dont keep any secrets , tease each others outfits and hair style , yet care more than any one about them , make each other laugh when they are sad , play lots of games and do gossip about things . They have had the deepest conversations with each other , cried with and for each other , been there at hard times , given each other life advices , and yet baekhyun reveals that sehun has a big nose and that kais armpit hair only grows on the lower side , chanyeol loving to bite baekhyuns butt and baekhyun biting sehuns butt all the time , suho and sehun subconciously always resting their hands on each others thighs , or chen whining suho to buy him things , or chen always roasting suho in shows saying that he is not funny ( by which i mean they dont act all nice to each other and polite cause they are like brothers ) . They hug each other and cling to each other , hit each other , laugh at and laugh with each other , make jokes , play lots of pranks ,eat , dance and sleep with each other . I cant say whether other groups are close or not cause i have not seen them offscreen but i can surely say that exo are darn it close to each other . You can see that they are not just close on screen cause if they had act to show people they are close they would be really sweet and nice to each other , or would compliment aech other about every single thing , say i love you or thank u to each other but they dont act so , they bully each other , tease each other , make fun , do pranks , hit each other , and yet kiss each other and hug each other whenever they are happy , smack each others butts , tear each others clothes so that fans can see the other persons body , share their wardrobe literally all the time and are just soooo comfortable with each othef all the time . They are themselves when they are together , so i can easily say that they are one of the most close kpop group out there .

Alongside BTOB, I would say Stray Kids. I’m quite surprised no one has mentioned them but they are a rookie group so I understand. If you watch any of their videos you will see it right away. As for being on the survival show, they’ve had members eliminated but then brought back later. JYP himself said that there was just something about having the nine of them together - their chemistry is undeniable. The leader of the group Chan trained for 7 years and has befriended many present and past JYP trainees, so it’s no surprise that he’s close with them. Having been there a for a long time, he’s seen his friends debut without him, ultimately leaving him alone in the dorms. However, he had the chance to debut and picked the members of the group himself, which I think already shows that their bond must have been great. After winning a rookie award, Chan broke down (on VLive) and said that without Stray Kids, there is no reason for him to live. Skz is a group which largely writes and produces their own songs, so we know how important these lyrics are to them. In songs such as I Am You and My Side they talk about their bond and how they’ve helped each other. The producing team 3RACHA write about a range of issues, most important here being depression, anxiety and suicidal thoughts. I think being able to articulate these feelings to another person and being able to write, compose and produce songs of these subjects shows how close and comfortable they are with each other. Also Jisung and Hyunjin have revealed they used to ‘hate’ each other and almost got to the point of having a physical fight. There’s a whole video of them talking about this, and you can see how comfortable they are with each other now. They said that since they had seen each others’ worst and weakest sides, they were able to get close faster with each other than anyone else in the group. The entire ‘Two Kids Room’ series is members talking about their relationships with each other, so it would be great to check out if you’re interested.

BTS and B.I.G. Without doubt, there's also other groups with close members, by after watching sooooooo many videos about these two groups, I can easily come to the conclusion that the members of both groups are very close. BTS: All the members are close with each other. Period. I’ll elaborate on a couple of their friendships, but I'll try not to bore you since I saw lots of other people also described BTS’ relationships. Tae and Jimin. The obvious choice. These two even call themselves soulmates. They have been spotted doing things together, and their genuine friendship shines on stage. They’re playful with each other, but you can see they truly care about one another. An example is when Tae was talking about his grandma after she passed away. Both him and Jimin were in tears, and Jimin came up to him and hugged him. Honestly these two are actual friendship goals Jimin and Jungkook. While Jungkook does tease Jimin about his height and such, they have a special relationship. A lot of moments about this relationship are more subtle. During the 4 Year Anniversary Stream, it was revealed that Jungkook only bought a gift for Jimin. Another example is in August 2016 when Jimin fainted and couldn't perform. Jungkook had to take over his parts. While singing, fans noticed that Jungkook’s nose was red, as if he was crying. These are just two of the adorable, amazing relationships in BTS! If I had to describe all of them, I would be writing this for hours :) Now onto B.I.G! This group is definitely close. During Curtain Talk, which B.I.G’s Benji was the MC for, they were fooling around the whole time and acting like best friends. There was no scripts either; it was genuine interactions between each other. I've also heard them use honorifics only a couple times, and I've seen nearly every video that has to do with them. If that doesn't show how close they are, then nothing does :D

Most of these are boy groups and that really annoys me, since half of the k-pop groups out there are girl groups! I’ve been following some k-pop girl groups for some time and while you can notice that most of them have some internal issues (including Twice: it seems that Jihyo can’t really stand the *gayness* of Nayeon and Momo), I’ve noticed that girl-groups aren’t as competitive as boy-groups and some of them have really amazing bonds, not only between the members of a particular band, but also with other groups too. With that being said, I will mention a few cases of girl-group friendship/bonds. EXID  EXID has been around for a long time, but they only become *famous* after their 4th–5th year together. From what I’ve seen, they are all really dorky with each other but also very supportive. During this year’s promotion, their main vocal (Solji) got sick and the rest of EXID decide to share the earnings of that promotion period with her (although she wasn’t performing with them during that period!). Currently, Solji is still resting and getting better, but you can see her uploading pictures of the rest of the group, cheering them up and being really nice with them! Oh My Girl!  One of the most cute and lovable girl-groups has proven constantly that they are really close. I’ve watched some episodes of Weekly Idol and in one of them, YooA and Binnie started crying and the rest of the band started hugging and taking care of them. This isn’t something very usual between Korean girl-groups (most of them are really cold with each other), but that’s not the case of OMG! I.O.I.  Although I.O.I was a temporary group (they were formed through a survival reality show on 2015 and disbanded almost a year ago), the bond that these girls created during their year together is really strong! All of them keep suppoting each other on their new groups and there are millions of pictures of them together behind the scenes! Some of them even had pijama-parties and it seems that their friendship is not only real but a very deep one!

I have to be biased and say… BTS. Runner up would be B.A.P, but it’s sometimes hard for me to say how close they are since they don’t seem as comfortable with cameras. BTS has always been hugely involved on social media so we see more of them. I have never, I mean never, seen a group of guys closer than BTS. Rap line has been living together for 7 years, and even Jimin who joined last lived with them for four-and-a-half years. Not only do they live together, they are forced to endure everything together. Aside from Jin, none of their families were rich. The company wasn’t well-off either. There is something unique about growing up less privileged together, then slaving your a**es off together, then becoming an international sensation together that results in a unique bond. In a big company like YG or SM, there are dozens of trainees, and the competition is fierce. But if you train hard and long enough, you can be placed into a group with relative certainty. In a small company like BigHit, it’s more close-knit and not as cutthroat, but the “when will I debut” question becomes even more agonizing when your company can only afford one group. So every person who made it into BTS knows that predebut struggle. You can see it now: every time they bring up predebut, all seven are thinking the exact same thing, of the exact same memories. Similarly, B.A.P is also from a small company and they struggled just as much as BTS, if not more. The fact that they all went through with the lawsuit together is a testament to their closeness. But in B.A.P the members are sort of separated, especially by age. In BTS Jin and Jungkook joke around like twins, Rap Monster mentors V, and they are generally such a team that you can’t pick out any “not-as-close” members. Only “not-as-into-public-skinship” members. They are amazingly not-awkward with each other. I don’t know how they do it, but I’m sure their frequent dorm conversations and heart-to-heart talks play a part. Every video of theirs shows little details that prove how close they are: when they hype up each others’ solos, when they share the prize of a game with the “losers,” when they teach each other how to perform to their best, when they comfort each other crying agh I’m getting emo now. I’ll stop. ** CEO Bang: “There may be some artists who may have difficulty making their own decisions, but the members of BTS enjoy their independence.” “[I promised] that I would help them become an established team as a producer if they believe in the team’s potential and do their best with their individual responsibilities.” So they work hard as a team, which I think makes them particularly close. For my fellow ARMYs, a Try Not To Cry Challenge:

I would have to go with BTS. Not only are they closest with each other but they are closest with their fans too. Deliberate constant lack of privacy, cameras recording their each and every move. From the maknae line deciding to play a silent game of hide and seek in the middle of the night while the hyungs are sleeping because they felt like it and then sharing the video with fans. Them crying, discussing their dreams, fears and criticism with each other without sugar coating any thing, in front of the camera. They are competative, honest, caring and close-knit so much so that even the fans know that Jin likes to cook, eat and feed others, Rapmon likes to go to a park alone to think, usually feels the weight of being a leader and Jimin consoling him, Suga is known to be savage and likes to be alone, he never hid his savage, dry but extremely caring and hardworking nature from the members or fans, Jhope aside from being the sunshine of the group can also make others cry if he starts to cry as the maknae line said. Well what to say about the three youngest members, they are the trouble makers, testing the patience of each other and their hyungs but so gentle inside that Jungkook, the youngest, dedicated his solo song to his Hyungs, Jimin is the guardian angel of the group, embracing the tearful, cheering the down, giving love to the needy members and checking chairs onstage before performance so no member gets hurt and when one of them slipped have a talk with the managers about the water on stage while V is the adorable koala bear usually seen riding the back of his members, trying to learn English from Rapmon and have such adorable 4D personality that even blundering through live programs the members can’t do any thing other than to laugh openly, Rapmon as the leader to hide his blushing cheeks, Suga as the swag filled one distancing himself with such a disgusted expression as if he can’t believe he is in a group with such idiots, but the next moment cheering Jhope on as if he is the best thing since sliced bred.

From what we see on screen I would say EXO, Super Junior, GOT7, Stray Kids and SHINee, just to name a few. For starters, EXO in general just seem like they’re brothers in the way that they act around each other. It’s very clear with the way that they tease and play around with each other that they’re very close. As Xiumin and Chen said on a show they did together, they’re like brothers from other mothers. With Super Junior, despite them always seeming to be arguing, it’s quite obvious how close they are because as soon as any other group says anything that’s even close to being insulting the others are immediately on the defense and helping out whoever it is that’s being teased. It’s like the sibling mentality of ‘Only I can tease my siblings’ GOT7 show that they’re close through constant teasing of each other. The entire group is known to roast each other and have no mercy when it comes to outing anything about each other. However, they are known to look after each other very well and it’s very clear how much they love each other. Despite Stray Kids still technically being a rookie group, it’s very clear that they’re all very close. It’s a well known fact that they help each other with dancing, rapping and singing and are constantly hyping each other up when it comes to something that someone may not be very good at. Out of all the groups I’ve mentioned I think that SHINee have the best bond. They’ve been through some horrible, heartbreaking things together, but they came out of them with their bond being even stronger. Despite the fact that Key may want to hit Minho in the head from time to time, it’s clear that they’re like brothers as they protect each other.

Well, I don't really stan that many groups, however it's safe to assume that most if not all kpop groups develop pretty strong friendships amongst themselves considering the time they spend together working hard to achieve their dream. However, here are some more details on the only 3 groups that I stan: BTS- Do I even need to explain this? Its no doubt they all love each other, their fans and their music. They've worked so hard and I'm so proud of them for coming from a small company, gaining popularity and success internationally and still staying so humble. Just watch them on American Hustle Life and you'll see how much their relationships have grown.GFriend- They come from a small company and each member has received some sort of specific hate. You can tell that they care for each other a lot and I'm sure that as the fandom grows, so will their love for each other (yes I know that was cheesy but it's true).Blackpink- Since most of their “hard working days” were when they were trainees (not that they don't work hard now) and for the most part on their own (until they were actually put together as a group), you'd think that their relationships aren't as strong but hey: they love each other so much that they chose not to decide a leader so that has to count for something.So yah these are the only ones I know about that are pretty close but overall I'd say BTS is the closest because they've been through a lot together for a longer amount of time than GFriend and Blackpink but again, I'm pretty sure all groups become close overtime because its natural considering how much they do together.

I haven’t searched up that much but I’d say: BTS,Rainbow,Stellar,EXID,After School and 9Muses. If you want to know who is genuinly close just look at who’s in contact after they disband. RAINBOW WENT ON A VACATION TOGETHER….After they disbanded.If that ain’t proof that they want to be around eachother,I don’t know what is. 9Muses members all showed up at the weddings of Hyuna and Sungah after they’ve long left their company. After School members have done the same by showing up at Jung ah’s wedding and Nana’s birthday.A lot of the members aren’t in the group anymore so again,there’s nothing forcing them to pretend. Stellar post videos of hanging out together after they left the company and independantly organized a goodbye fan meet for their fans. EXID to me,seems pretty close both because of what they went through and how they act towards eachother.Still,only time will tell. BTS-Honestly,it’s too soon to tell but it’s a plus when other celebities list you as an example of a group that gets along.(Jessi) Final note:groups who aren’t close are no less or more good from those who are.This is primarily their job.Idols don’t join companies to find friends.They join them to make careers.Friendships are a bonus that some are lucky to get. There’s also the fact that members could be genuinly close while the group is active and then life makes them distant but because kpop relies so much on manufacturing this image of friendship,you won’t know when it is genuine.

B.A.P by a longshot. They filed a lawsuit against their company together. They waited until the youngest member of the group turned 18 to file together. Even through this lawsuit they stuck together as 6 and promised fans that they would stay together even after their contracts end. When their leader, Bang Yongguk, went on hiatus due to his deteriorating mental health they took over his spot until he got the help that was needed. After Yongguk’s contract ended in August 2018 he assured fans that this wasn’t the end of B.A.P and that he was always gonna be a part B.A.P even if, legally, he wasn’t anymore. He even replied to one of his members tweets to be safe and to update him on the tour that they were doing without him after his contract ended. These boys genuinely care for each other and are so close that they consider each other as brothers. Now, not many kpop groups will admit to this in fear that fans will get offended but Yongguk once said that although he’s thankful for his fans, he’s more thankful towards his members. Awww. :’)  This is one of the many reasons - and the strongest reason - why I love them and will remain a loyal fan. Through thick and thin we’ll stay together as one. A lawsuit isn’t gonna break us. Now that I know what we’re capable of I know we’ll only be stronger from here on out. We just have to trust them and I do. I’ll be eagerly waiting for the day where they reunite as 6 without the bonds of their shitty company holding them back. Babyz will always be With You! :)

SUPER JUNIOR Maybe its the loooong time they’ve been together as a group - years of trainees, 10 years of being active and counting.. Maybe its the huge number of members - 13 originally, plus 2 China Member - which kinda force them to adapt to different 13 personalities, needs, passions, and dreams… Maybe its the many dramas, ups & downs together during those times - huge accident(s), DUI cases, fights between members, members’ contract termination, etc… Maybe its their families who also grew up together with them - its a widely-known facts that Suju members siblings often go for hangout together. Their sisters will go to wedding invitations on their place, together. Their parents taking care of all Suju members like they were all their own children.. Maybe its the challenges they faced as the one of the early K-pop boyband who went global - boy how different it was to be in 2007 and now. Back then, internet is a privilege, Youtube is not as big as now, social medias were just start-ups. Being a K-pop fans, you will receive this negative judgement from your friends and almost everyone considering K-pop as something of low quality. We were absolutely a minority.. I have to admit I am no longer intensely following reality/documentary show on newer groups but when you see Suju on any show, together, it is obvious that their bond is as close as family could ever be..

I only stan a few groups, so I’ll tell you the ones I know but there are lots and lots of groups that are really close because of all the hardship they have to go through. TWICE  I know that this group is genuinely close due to being on the survival show Sixteen. They shared a lot of laughter, tears, and overall bonding moments. This is my bias group so I know a lot about them, and their closeness is not acting. SEVENTEEN  Gotta love these guys! You can tell how close they are just by watching them interact with each other. The way the joke, hug, talk, and play around shows it all. Plus, Jeonghan even said that they were so close that the members could kiss each other (and even though the rest of the members protested the kissing part, you get the point of the statement) GOT7  This is a group that I got into from watching their show, Real Got7. If they were faking being close there than they’re really good actors, because they seem like brothers rather than a group. Plus their most recent concept, 7 for 7, is about how close they are as friends, and how it’s always gonna be all 7 of them or none. They even made a friendship necklace where each member has a piece and it forms the shape of their logo *i’m not crying, you’re crying*  (that’s the necklace, if you were curious) Those are the ones that I know, but like I said at the beginning, there are probably plenty more that I just haven’t gotten into yet.

response.answer_text: Which K-pop groups have the closest members?  There's a lot of that going on across the K-pop stratosphere, so I will smartly stick to the group I know best: Twice. And there's 9 of them. So I'll trim it down to two ladies who always seemed closer together than with the other members. Sana and Momo. They were born in the same year, so by Korean standards there was already the makings of a friendship. But they had that covered already…  The two came to Korea “together,” which doesn't mean they were friends before training. They probably met right before and their friendship blossomed from the start. No doubt they were glad to find each other, being the only Japanese trainees as Mina came in much later. In that time they no doubt had to share some ups and downs. When Momo was eliminated from “Sixteen,” Sana was shattered.  Theirs is a very loving relationship.  There's lots of shipping, but to be fair, these two give fans lots of ammo for that.  Lots of bickering too…  But you know what they do that nobody ever talks about? They dress alike. All the time.  Momo goes online and teaches fans choreography. One time she brought in Sana to assist her (which Lead Dancers should do, but that's a debate for another question). Momo called her her “twin,” leading gullible fans to even claim they were blood sisters for awhile. So, of course they dressed in exact track suits. I thought it was cute.  Then I started paying attention. This is what they do. It's not just that they share clothes. They all seem to do that. Like Sana and Tzuyu here:  I have two sisters. In my experience…  …females do that often. I'm not talking about that. I'm saying they dress alike. All the time.  Sometimes it's by accident. They don't sleep in the same room, they don't always know what the other is gonna wear that day. But they also plan it.  They vacationed in Hawaii together, without the other members. They dressed alike there.    Sana and Momo are today's picks. They are so close that even they think they're twins.

FT Island - They are too honest to the public especially to each other. They may look like they humiliate one another but that's one of the reasons why their bond is still very strong for more than 10 years. They may not live in one dorm anymore, but making music is what stick them together the most. They are just like their instruments. One should never be left out no matter what. When it comes to music, they are in sync. Their performances never fail to amaze fans. They rather spill the beans themselves than give the media the satisfaction of spreading the juicy news. Minhwan (their maknae) always loves talking about the band as 5. Hongki mentioned that no matter what, he will protect FT Island.   SHINee - Bromance doesn't bother them one bit. It's because they are very affectionate to one another. They all have big and soft hearts. Taemin and Jonghyun often miss having group activities everytime they do their solo activities. They always mention SHINee and the members. In the past, the older members always protect their maknae. The members return to Knowing bros because Jonghyun was 'bullied' by the cast. To make it short, they have each other's back. They may fight like cats and dogs but they are also ready to protect one another. I really don't need to say more, after all what SHINee had been through. They did their all to be whole no matter what untill the very end.   When a group has been together for more than 10 years, it's impossible they won't feel attach to one another. I'm not saying 10 years below won't feel like this. It's the fact that it's been 10 years working with one another.

I have looked around and I didn’t see anyone mentioned Super Junior and Dong Bang Shin Ki, what a regret! These two groups are neighbors of each other since pre-debut, and their friendship is noisily famous and famously noisy (I know it’s a weird collocation). DBSJ has a fandom named “the Pepsi fandom” (it comes from the fact that pearl red color symbols DBSK and sapphire blue symbols SJ - that two colors will make the logo of Pepsi LOL). They released a song with 17 members named Show Me Your Love (this was covered by Seventeen). SJ Eunhyuk and DBSK Junsu studied in the same secondary school and had been best friends long before they were trained together (They even dressed as girls together in a festival - now that is embarrassing). SJ Kangin-Heechul and DBSK Yunho-Jaejoong were almost debutted under the name “Four Seasons” (though it was rumoured that the group immediately disbanded as they ate too much…) DBSK Yunho (the leader) saved coins in a water container, and SJ Leeteuk (leader) admitted that he had stolen some money from him to buy food for his children (SJ members) in pre-debut days. They were trained together from their 10s to the official debut stage, and they had lived in the same dorm for those years. There are many famous cross friendships between the two groups like Hangeng-Jaejoong, Heechul-Jaejoong (still continues with Tony Hong and F.T.Island Lee Hongki), Changmin-Kyuhyun (the Evil Maknae duo)… Even recently, when they enlisted in the army, they still met one another. DBSK Jaejoong and SJ Leeteuk-Eunhyuk-Heechul have just bought apartments in the same condominium. There are so many many many things more to tell, but I can’t remember them all. They are becoming ahjusshis LOL but their friendship will stay the same forever, I hope. Besides, the Shinhwa friendship is also awesome. Six members stayed together for almost two decades UNDER THE SAME NAME, and I guess, in their 40s now, they are becoming something more than just brothers. Recalling all these things has brought me to the verge of bursting into laughters and tears at the same time.

I am not biased saying this because I Stan more than 13 group , but TAENY are totally the closest friendship I ever seen in KPOP not just KPOP but between artists Just the way they look at each other its like they find each other the most precious thing in their life , SOME reasons why: tiffany treated taeyeon like her own mother becauae she didnt have one, and basically they have been living together even since they were 15 or 14 and tiffany diary is all about saying that taeyeon was next to her and how close they are when they just were 15–6 , when no one knew english , tiffany couldnt talk with anyone but taeyeon was able to understand her in a way, on tiffany birthday taeyeon got her a gift worth 3000$ , and to not leave tiffany alone in holidays she takess her with her to her family house in the village , that's why tiffany is really close to taeyeon family , they once went ALONE together to L.A to Disneyland to have their little date I cant find a closer friendship than this, the fact they call each other wife becauae being best friend to them is not enough to describe their friendship , once in taeyeon birthday she was asked what do u want for u birthday she said (Tiffanys love is enough for me) tiffany laughed and said (taeyeon love is enough for me too) In a radio station with TTS the memberss have to give a song that she wants to say to the member next to her , taeyeon declared the song (I need u) to tiffany Taeyeon once said (thank u for being in my life , without u my life would mean nothing , youre a person i need in my life ) and she cried while saying that, imagining her life without tiffany , I actually just gave some things about their friendship but just their look between each other eyes says it all

EXO - As someone who has been with them since the beginning you can clearly tell that they have a genuine bond. They have been through so much since their trainee days, and still are close to each other. Lay still keeps in contact with EXO when he is in China, Chan and Baek have considered each other best friends before, Sehun and Suho literal older brother-younger brother love, Chen and Xiumin must I say anymore? They are genuinely close, and many bts videos will give you a view on how close they are. The aura they give off onstage is that of a family, and when I went to their EXO’rDIUM LA concert (2017) it was just like that. A family, Baek and D.O fighting. Sehun being shy while the other members manhandled him. An their proud faces whenever Sehun had his lines. I had clear view of Suho smiling like a proud father when Sehun was rapping during Monster. BTS. RM, Suga, Jhope, Jungkook, V, Jin and Jimin are really close with each other. You can see it when you watch their videos. I’ll tell you a little from their pre debut stories. Jhope used to left the company when he was a trainee and he said in the Burn The Stage (their docu-series on Youtube Red), he came back because of the members. because he trusts them. and RM said (when Jhope decided to left the company), that they can’t do well without him (Jhope). they need him to do well.Jungkook got offered by 7 agencies (if I’m not mistaken) and some of them are big in Korea, but he decided to go to Bighit which is a small company back then because he heard RM’s rap.Jin is coming from a well-living family but he used his allowance to buy food to eat with the members.these are just some stories they’ve shared. and honestly, their bond with each other is like a family. you can see this if you watch their videos on BangtanTV or their Vlive Channel or just literally their “behind the scene” videos.

I’m going to go with BTS, Stray Kids, and GOT7. These are the boy groups, and I can vouch for them because I know how much of a close relationship they have. I won’t be discussing BTS and GOT7 because people have already explained it, but I will go on for Stray Kids. Stray Kids members were chosen by the leader, Bang Chan himself, and weren’t put in a random lineup by JYP. Furthermore, they went through a survival program to debut as the 9 (original members, Woojin left the group later on). Two members were eliminated in the process- Felix and Lee Know. JYP thought that as this 7 member lineup, they were perfect, but he also felt that their chemistry on stage and charisma was better as 9, so he gave Felix and Lee Know another chance. The members worked extra hard to put up their best stage as 9, and debuted as 9. You can see the love they have for each other. They bicker a lot, and are really close. As for girl groups, there’s Red Velvet, and TWICE. Blackpink, also, to some extent, but that cannot be very strongly vouched for due to the lack of content. I’d like to summarize this by saying that most groups would be very close to each other, but these groups I listed are the ones that I can say for sure are super close.

I was going through all the answers and was surprised that no one mentioned this gem of a group who resurrected their own career from the ashes, after being neglected by their own company. If any group that first comes to my mind for being genuinely close to each other, then it is…. NU'EST  Explosive hit debut? Mismanagement by company? Failure after hitting rock bottom? Rise of career from the ashes to becoming one of the top boygroups in Kpop today? This group has seen it all. Its no surprise to Kpop fans that every year hundreds of groups debut, but only a handful of them actually manage to make it big and have a respectable career in this cutthroat industry. And if you come from a small company? Your probability of not making it big multiplies by manifold. NUEST debuted in 2012 under Pledis Entertainment with the hit title track “Face". This MV is one of the most viewed debut MVs in Kpop of all time, garnering 110M+ views till date. It even peaked at No.15 on the MelOn chart in 2012, an impressive feat for rookies.  (They debuted way too young. 4 boys were 16 at the time, being 95-liners, and 1 member was 18 in age, being 93-liner) However…… Things started going downhill. Pledis entertainment shifted the focus of NU'EST from Korea, to international shores of China and Japan in their rookie years itself. This was a grave error, which they eventually realised later on, but by then it was too late. These international ventures in the group's rookie years stunted their potential growth of a stable, loyal fanbase in Korea, as a result they lost majority of their fandom in Korea. And to add on, they had long hiatuses between each Korean comeback, which worsened the situation. As a result, this reflected in their sales. Even after 4-5 years of being active in the industry, NU'EST sold only about 500-600 copies of their albums!! . . . In 2017 the group made a decision that would eventually go on to change the course of their career forever. 4 out of 5 of the NU'EST members participated on Season 2 of the hit survival show of Mnet Produce 101. (Kang Dongho, Kim Jonghyun, Choi Minki, Hwang Minhyun) All of them are 95-liners.  But it was not easy. These days many debuted group members give a shot at making it big on the show, but back then it was practically unheard of for a 5 year old active idol boygroup to downgrade themselves to the status of trainees and compete on a “trainee survival show". They got accused of “cheating" since they apparently already had a fanbase; had to swallow their pride and even say it clearly on camera that even their company had given up on them. It was their last shot at saving their group from disbandment. And it was their own decision to take this last chance for saving the group. Their gamble and hardwork did pay off. All 4 members reached the top 20 in the finale. 3 of the members gained massive popularity during the course of the show (Kim Jonghyun, Kang Dongho and Hwang Minhyun). And one member (Hwang Minhyun) made the cut to Wanna One. Miraculously, while the show was still airing, all of NU'EST old albums were reportedly sold out at a number of major sites! And many of their old songs reverse-charted after years on Korean Music charts. Their 2013 song “Hello" even became eligible for a 1st place win on Inkigayo after 4 years!! . This is a feat that has till date never been repeated by any idol group on Produce 101. . While Minhyun promoted with Wanna One, the remaining 4 members promoted as the massively popular subunit NU'EST W for the time. NU'EST W topped domestic charts with every release and made a successful name for themselves in the Kpop market. Their first ever career music show win came with “Where You At" in 2017 (after just 9 days of song release). . NU'EST W released hits like If You, Where You At, Dejavu and Help Me, etc. that topped MelOn and all Korean charts right on release! . From the boys who once couldn't sell even 100 tickets for their fanmeeting, were able to sell out 10,000 seats right-off-the-bat after Produce 101 massive popularity, as NU'EST W, with about 200k people still waiting online for tickets lol. (Hence rightfully called “ reversal icons " of Kpop).  . (From selling barely 600 albums in 1st week to 220,000+ albums in 1st week, NU'EST certainly came a very long way) . After the disbandment of Wanna One, Minhyun came back to complete his original group, and NU'EST got their first full group win with “Bet Bet" in 2019. The group sold out a 3 day concert at KSPO Dome (Olympic Gymnastics Park). Selling out this arena is a mark of huge status of popularity for any group, and by selling out the KSPO Dome for 3 nights with 36000 total capacity, NU'EST reinstated their status as a top boy group in Korea today.  (Above) NU'EST W first ever solo concert (Double You) 2018  (Above) NU'EST Ot5 1st solo concert (Sold out for 3 days) at KSPO DOME. (Segno) 2019 . Their accumulated album sales have crossed 1.2 Million+ sales till date officially making them a MILLION SELLER GROUP according to Gaon (only 12 groups have achieved this status in the past 13 years), and getting Platinum-certified album with every comeback. . . . These 5 boys have went through a lot. They have seen extreme ups and downs throughout their career, yet they held their ground and stayed together through everything. They did not disband, and successfully broke the 7 year curse of Kpop. The only group to get a full group first win after contract renewals!! And that too after their 7 year anniversary. They have expressed it themselves that they wish to stay together for a long time, like Shinhwa and H.O.T. . . I cannot say much about other groups, but when it comes to NU'EST they are genuinely one of the closest groups out there. Their whole rollercoaster of a journey is testimony to this fact.

Depends on you definition of ‘close’. If i had to pick a particular group, i would have to say none. You cannot and will not see anything ‘genuine’ as a fan. AS much as you try to be unbiased and objective, your imagination will runaway from you. Kpop is a terribly competitive world that is deeply rooted in public appeal above all else. What you see is what they want you to see. At the end of the day, it is a business and this is their job. That’s their livelihood. each trainee in a group is willing to give their all and expects the other trainees to do so as well.They expect the other person to want it as bad they want it. That is the foundation of their friendship. They will respect each another for that core reason. But if your asking if they would consider themselves ‘family’ or a ‘brotherhood/sisterhood’. Then no. You will get genuine friendships like jin and ken or changmin and kyuhyun. Once you factor in that they didn’t have a choice in their members and that their livelihood relies on their joint success. The word ‘genuine’ cannot be applied.

I honestly feel like most K-pop groups are genuinely quite close. You train with the others for many years before debuting, and you have to go through a lot together to make it as a group. Besides, companies make sure that the trainees are agreeable and friendly with each other before the group debuts. If they aren’t close, the only other chance they have to make friends would be with the staff or other idols, since they don’t have time to interact with anyone else. Idol groups live together and are literally never without each other - they sleep in the same rooms, they train for dances together, they perform at concerts together, they go to variety shows together, and one group apparently bathes together.  There are a lot of inter-group friendships as well, although the male idols seem to have an easier time making friends with other idols because companies like to pit female idols against each other for whatever reason. Some of the closest groups, though, would probably be 1st and 2nd generation groups - simply because they’ve known each other for such a long time.

Don’t bust my ass for this. The truth is, NO ONE KNOWS. To be exact, no one other than the people in the group knows about their bond. A good rule of thumb: the higher they are, the harder they’ll fall. In the end, KPop fans will face the hard truth that their idol’s fame is also their eventual downfall. They’ll witness the disintegrating “friendship”. They could have been genuine friends as they climbed to the pinnacle of success, but once they reach their goals (or most of their goals), it’s good bye friendship, hello cha ching! The first contract renewal is usually fine, smooth-sailing. Unless they got a slave contract, because that’s a whole lot of chaos before the renewal happens. IF there will even be a renewal. The videos of your stans and ships being all sweetness lovey-dovey or adorably “fighting”? Don’t trust the content, darling. It’s not a Kpop industry for nothing. Everything’s manufactured for the clients’ satisfaction. In case you’re being delightfully obtuse, YOU are their client/customer/fan/follower. You want the friendship and family narrative special? They got it for you. Don’t delude yourself that all’s genuine though.
